intro: Apodanthera hirtella, commonly known as the hairy apodanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apodanthaceae, which is characterized by its unique parasitic relationships with certain trees. The plant is distinguished by its small, hairy leaves and its ability to produce small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in association with specific host species. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
